title: How to Put Books on a Kindle

steps.title: Make sure that your Kindle is connected to Wi-Fi.
steps.content: Make sure that your Kindle is connected to Wi-Fi . Your Kindle will need to have an Internet connection in order to accept incoming files. If your Kindle is incapable of connecting to Wi-Fi, you'll need to use your Kindle's USB cable to transfer an eBook instead.

steps.title: Open Amazon.
steps.content: Open Amazon. Go to https://www.amazon.com/ in your computer's web browser. This will open your Amazon home page if you're logged in. [1] X Research source If you aren't logged in, select Account & Lists , click Sign in , and enter your email address and password .

steps.title: Select Account & Lists.
steps.content: Select Account & Lists . It's in the upper-right side of the page. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Click Your Content and Devices.
steps.content: Click Your Content and Devices . You'll find this option in the lower-right side of the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Select your book.
steps.content: Select your book. Click the checkbox to the left of a book that you want to move onto your Kindle. You may have to scroll down to find the book that you want to move.

steps.title: Click Deliver.
steps.content: Click Deliver . It's a yellow button in the upper-left side of the page. A pop-up window will appear. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click the "Devices Selected" box.
steps.content: Click the "Devices Selected" box. This option is in the middle of the pop-up window. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Select your Kindle.
steps.content: Select your Kindle. Click your Kindle's name in the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Deliver.
steps.content: Click Deliver . It's a yellow button in the lower-right side of the window. Doing so will prompt the eBook to move onto your Kindle as long as the Kindle itself is connected to Wi-Fi.

steps.title: Make sure that your Kindle is connected to Wi-Fi.
steps.content: Make sure that your Kindle is connected to Wi-Fi. Your Kindle will need to have an Internet connection in order to accept incoming files. If your Kindle is incapable of connecting to Wi-Fi, you'll need to use your Kindle's USB cable to transfer an eBook instead.

steps.title: Open Amazon.
steps.content: Open Amazon. Go to https://www.amazon.com/ in your computer's web browser. This will open your Amazon home page if you're logged in. If you aren't logged in, select Account & Lists , click Sign in , and enter your email address and password.

steps.title: Select Account & Lists.
steps.content: Select Account & Lists . It's in the upper-right side of the page. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Click Your Content and Devices.
steps.content: Click Your Content and Devices . You'll find this option in the lower-right side of the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click the Preferences tab.
steps.content: Click the Preferences tab. It's at the top of the page.

steps.title: Scroll down and click Personal Document Settings.
steps.content: Scroll down and click Personal Document Settings . You'll find this heading near the middle of the page. Clicking it prompts several options to appear below the heading. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Click the Add a new approved e-mail address link.
steps.content: Click the Add a new approved e-mail address link. It's at the bottom of the Personal Document Settings heading's section. A pop-up window will appear. If you already have an email address here, make sure you know what it is, then skip the next step.

steps.title: Add an email address.
steps.content: Add an email address. Type in the email address that you use for your Kindle, then click Add Address .

steps.title: Open your preferred email inbox on your computer.
steps.content: Open your preferred email inbox on your computer. This can be literally any email inbox (e.g., Gmail ) for which you have an account.

steps.title: Create a new email.
steps.content: Create a new email . Click the New or Compose button to open a new email, then add your Kindle's email address to the "To" text field.

steps.title: Add your eBook as an attachment.
steps.content: Add your eBook as an attachment . Click the "Attachment" icon, then select your eBook's file. [4] X Research source Your eBook can be in AZW, PDF, or MOBI format. If it isn't in one of these formats, you'll need to convert it before you send it. Most email services have a 25 MB limit on attachments. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Send your email.
steps.content: Send your email. Click the Send button to do so. As long as your Kindle is connected to Wi-Fi, the eBook will be received and downloaded onto your Kindle.

steps.title: Download an eBook from Amazon.
steps.content: Download an eBook from Amazon. If you have an Amazon eBook that you want to add to your Kindle via USB, go to Amazon and log in if necessary, then do the following: Select Account & Lists Click Your Content and Devices Click ... to the left of a book. Click Download & transfer via USB Select your Kindle from the drop-down box. Click OK

steps.title: Convert your eBook if necessary.
steps.content: Convert your eBook if necessary. If your eBook isn't already in PDF, AZW, or MOBI format, you'll need to do the following before you can put it on your Kindle: Go to the EPUB to MOBI converter website in your computer's web browser. Select the proper file-to-file converter on the left side of the page. Click Add File... Select your eBook's file. Click Open Click Start Upload Click the MOBI file's link in the "Download Link" column to download it onto your computer.

steps.title: Copy the MOBI file.
steps.content: Copy the MOBI file. Click your eBook's MOBI file to select it, then press Ctrl + C (Windows) or ⌘ Command + C (Mac) to copy the file.

steps.title: Connect your Kindle
steps.content: Connect your Kindle to your computer. Plug the charging end of your Kindle's charger cable into the Kindle, then plug the USB end of the cable into your computer. If you're using a Mac, you might not have traditional USB ports; if so, you'll need a USB 3.0 to USB-C adapter for your computer.

steps.title: Open the Kindle.
steps.content: Open the Kindle. The process of doing this will vary depending on whether you're using a Windows computer or a Mac: [6] X Research source Windows - Open Start , click File Explorer , click This PC , and double-click your Kindle's name. Mac - Open Finder , then click your Kindle's name on the left side of the window. Your Kindle may also appear on the desktop.

steps.title: Open the "Documents" folder.
steps.content: Open the "Documents" folder. Double-click the "Documents" or "Internal Documents" folder that's in your Kindle's storage folder to do so. [7] X Research source You may first need to unlock the Kindle and/or double-click the "Internal Storage" folder. If you're using a Kindle Fire, you'll open the "Books" folder instead.

steps.title: Paste in the MOBI file.
steps.content: Paste in the MOBI file. Click a blank space in the folder, then press Ctrl + V (Windows) or ⌘ Command + V (Mac) to do so.

steps.title: Wait for the MOBI file to finish transferring.
steps.content: Wait for the MOBI file to finish transferring. When the indicator light on your Kindle's cable stops blinking, you can proceed.

steps.title: Eject your Kindle.
steps.content: Eject your Kindle. This will ensure that your files are saved before you remove the Kindle from your computer: [8] X Research source Windows - Click in the lower-right corner of the screen, click the flash drive-shaped icon, and click Eject in the resulting menu. Mac - Click the "Eject" triangle to the right of the Kindle's name in Finder.
